data.title: Double the letters
data.statement:
You are given a string [[s]].
After each alpha character in the string, add the same letter, but in the opposite case.
In other words, if the letter is uppercase, add the same letter in lowercase after it, and vice-versa.

testCases.title: Test 3
testCases.testIn: Letter case is the distinction between the letters that are in larger uppercase or capitals.
testCases.testOut: LleEtTtTeErR cCaAsSeE iIsS tThHeE dDiIsStTiInNcCtTiIoOnN bBeEtTwWeEeEnN tThHeE lLeEtTtTeErRsS tThHaAtT aArReE iInN lLaArRgGeErR uUpPpPeErRcCaAsSeE oOrR cCaApPiItTaAlLsS.

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn: Single-word proper nouns are capitalised in formal written English, unless the name is intentionally stylised to break this rule.
testCases.testOut: SsiInNgGlLeE-wWoOrRdD pPrRoOpPeErR nNoOuUnNsS aArReE cCaApPiItTaAlLiIsSeEdD iInN fFoOrRmMaAlL wWrRiItTtTeEnN EenNgGlLiIsShH, uUnNlLeEsSsS tThHeE nNaAmMeE iIsS iInNtTeEnNtTiIoOnNaAlLlLyY sStTyYlLiIsSeEdD tToO bBrReEaAkK tThHiIsS rRuUlLeE.

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testIn: Of the seven SI base-unit symbols, "A" (ampere for electric current) and "K" (kelvin for temperature), both named after people, are always written in upper case, whereas "s" (second for time), "m" (metre for length), "kg" (kilogram for mass), "cd" (candela for luminous intensity), and "mol" (mole for amount of substance) are written in lower case.
testCases.testOut: OofF tThHeE sSeEvVeEnN SsIi bBaAsSeE-uUnNiItT sSyYmMbBoOlLsS, "Aa" (aAmMpPeErReE fFoOrR eElLeEcCtTrRiIcC cCuUrRrReEnNtT) aAnNdD "Kk" (kKeElLvViInN fFoOrR tTeEmMpPeErRaAtTuUrReE), bBoOtThH nNaAmMeEdD aAfFtTeErR pPeEoOpPlLeE, aArReE aAlLwWaAyYsS wWrRiItTtTeEnN iInN uUpPpPeErR cCaAsSeE, wWhHeErReEaAsS "sS" (sSeEcCoOnNdD fFoOrR tTiImMeE), "mM" (mMeEtTrReE fFoOrR lLeEnNgGtThH), "kKgG" (kKiIlLoOgGrRaAmM fFoOrR mMaAsSsS), "cCdD" (cCaAnNdDeElLaA fFoOrR lLuUmMiInNoOuUsS iInNtTeEnNsSiItTyY), aAnNdD "mMoOlL" (mMoOlLeE fFoOrR aAmMoOuUnNtT oOfF sSuUbBsStTaAnNcCeE) aArReE wWrRiItTtTeEnN iInN lLoOwWeErR cCaAsSeE.

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn: The lower-case "a" and upper-case "A" are the two case variants of the first letter in the English alphabet.
testCases.testOut: TthHeE lLoOwWeErR-cCaAsSeE "aA" aAnNdD uUpPpPeErR-cCaAsSeE "Aa" aArReE tThHeE tTwWoO cCaAsSeE vVaArRiIaAnNtTsS oOfF tThHeE fFiIrRsStT lLeEtTtTeErR iInN tThHeE EenNgGlLiIsShH aAlLpPhHaAbBeEtT.

data.stubGenerator:
read s:string(1024)
write s with repeated letters
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> the string [[s]] with the repeated letters

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given a string s.
After each alpha character in the string, add the same letter, but in the opposite case.
In other words, if the letter is uppercase, add the same letter in lowercase after it, and vice-versa.
Input
line 1: string s
Output
Line 1 : the string s with the repeated letters
Constraints
Example
Input
Hello World!
Output
HheElLlLoO WwoOrRlLdD!
